comments.body: random note, won't this introduce a conflict for `implicitly[Sync[F]]` inside `f4`?

Sure, but this is not the important bit of this test case. If you look at the corresponding input file, you'll see that the scalafix removed a `ContextShift[F]` parameter in the middle of the parameter list and that is the only thing we're testing here. The types of `F1` and `F2` are irrelevant.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@  def f3[F[_]](implicit F: Sync[F]): Int = 0

  def f4[F[_]](implicit F1: Sync[F], F2: Sync[F]): Int = 0

  def f5[F[_]](implicit F: Async[F]): F[Unit] = Spawn[F].cede
